trans-unit.source: Set Container ACL
trans-unit.target: Set Container ACL

trans-unit.source: Set Container ACL
trans-unit.target: Set Container ACL

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation sets the permissions for the specified container.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation sets the permissions for the specified container.

trans-unit.source: The permissions indicate whether blobs in a container may be accessed publicly.
trans-unit.target: The permissions indicate whether blobs in a container may be accessed publicly.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with the 2009-09-19 version, the container permissions provide the following options for managing container access:
trans-unit.target: Beginning with the 2009-09-19 version, the container permissions provide the following options for managing container access:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Full public read access:</embeddedLabel> Container and blob data can be read via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Full public read access:</embeddedLabel> Container and blob data can be read via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Public read access for blobs only:</embeddedLabel> Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Public read access for blobs only:</embeddedLabel> Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.

trans-unit.source: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>No public read access:</embeddedLabel> Container and blob data can be read by the account owner only.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>No public read access:</embeddedLabel> Container and blob data can be read by the account owner only.

trans-unit.source: <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> also sets a stored access policy for use with shared access signatures.
trans-unit.target: <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> also sets a stored access policy for use with shared access signatures.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: All public access to the container is anonymous, as is access via a shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: All public access to the container is anonymous, as is access via a shared access signature.

trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Storage Service Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access.

trans-unit.source: Possible values include:
trans-unit.target: Possible values include:

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>container</parameterReference>: Specifies full public read access for container and blob data.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>container</parameterReference>: Specifies full public read access for container and blob data.

trans-unit.source: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Clients can enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request, but cannot enumerate containers within the storage account.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>blob:</parameterReference> Specifies public read access for blobs.
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>blob:</parameterReference> Specifies public read access for blobs.

trans-unit.source: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.
trans-unit.target: Blob data within this container can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available.

trans-unit.source: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.
trans-unit.target: Clients cannot enumerate blobs within the container via anonymous request.

trans-unit.source: If this header is not included in the request, container data is private to the account owner.
trans-unit.target: If this header is not included in the request, container data is private to the account owner.

trans-unit.source: Note that setting public access for a container in an Azure Premium Storage account is not permitted.
trans-unit.target: Note that setting public access for a container in an Azure Premium Storage account is not permitted.

trans-unit.source: Optional, version 2012-02-12 and newer.
trans-unit.target: Optional, version 2012-02-12 and newer.

trans-unit.source: If specified, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> only succeeds if the container's lease is active and matches this ID.
trans-unit.target: If specified, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> only succeeds if the container's lease is active and matches this ID.

trans-unit.source: If there is no active lease or the ID does not match, 412 (Precondition Failed) is returned.
trans-unit.target: If there is no active lease or the ID does not match, 412 (Precondition Failed) is returned.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.
trans-unit.target: This operation also supports the use of conditional headers to execute the operation only if a specified condition is met.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="36087161-9e7c-47e4-904c-3392cc35a8e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying Conditional Headers for Blob Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: To specify a stored access policy, provide a unique identifier and access policy in the request body for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.
trans-unit.target: To specify a stored access policy, provide a unique identifier and access policy in the request body for the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>SignedIdentifier</languageKeyword> element includes the unique identifier, as specified in the <languageKeyword>Id</languageKeyword> element, and the details of the access policy, as specified in the <languageKeyword>AccessPolicy</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>SignedIdentifier</languageKeyword> element includes the unique identifier, as specified in the <languageKeyword>Id</languageKeyword> element, and the details of the access policy, as specified in the <languageKeyword>AccessPolicy</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the unique identifier is 64 characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the unique identifier is 64 characters.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Start</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Expiry</languageKeyword> fields must be expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8061 format.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Start</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Expiry</languageKeyword> fields must be expressed as UTC times and must adhere to a valid ISO 8061 format.

trans-unit.source: Supported ISO 8061 formats include the following:
trans-unit.target: Supported ISO 8061 formats include the following:

trans-unit.source: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.
trans-unit.target: For the date portion of these formats, <codeInline>YYYY</codeInline> is a four-digit year representation, <codeInline>MM</codeInline> is a two-digit month representation, and <codeInline>DD</codeInline> is a two-digit day representation.

trans-unit.source: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation, and <codeInline>fffffff</codeInline> is the seven-digit millisecond representation.
trans-unit.target: For the time portion, <codeInline>hh</codeInline> is the hour representation in 24-hour notation, <codeInline>mm</codeInline> is the two-digit minute representation, <codeInline>ss</codeInline> is the two-digit second representation, and <codeInline>fffffff</codeInline> is the seven-digit millisecond representation.

trans-unit.source: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.
trans-unit.target: A time designator <codeInline>T</codeInline> separates the date and time portions of the string, while a time zone designator <codeInline>TZD</codeInline> specifies a time zone.

trans-unit.target: Sample Request

trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response header
trans-unit.target: Response header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The ETag for the container.
trans-unit.target: The ETag for the container.

trans-unit.source: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.
trans-unit.target: If the request version is 2011-08-18 or newer, the ETag value will be in quotes.

trans-unit.source: Returns the date and time the container was last modified.
trans-unit.target: Returns the date and time the container was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The date format follows RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date format follows RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values</link>.

trans-unit.source: Any operation that modifies the container or its properties or metadata updates the last modified time, including setting the container's permissions.
trans-unit.target: Any operation that modifies the container or its properties or metadata updates the last modified time, including setting the container's permissions.

trans-unit.source: Operations on blobs do not affect the last modified time of the container.
trans-unit.target: Operations on blobs do not affect the last modified time of the container.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may access resources in a particular container, unless the owner has specified that container resources are available for public access by setting the permissions on the container, or has issued a shared access signature for a resource within the container.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may access resources in a particular container, unless the owner has specified that container resources are available for public access by setting the permissions on the container, or has issued a shared access signature for a resource within the container.

trans-unit.source: When you set permissions for a container, the existing permissions are replaced.
trans-unit.target: When you set permissions for a container, the existing permissions are replaced.

trans-unit.source: To update the container's permissions, call <link xlink:href="cc52e59f-2cb5-41b8-9ed8-3c9513dba389" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Container ACL</link> to fetch all access policies associated with the container, modify the access policy that you wish to change, and then call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the complete set of data to perform the update.
trans-unit.target: To update the container's permissions, call <link xlink:href="cc52e59f-2cb5-41b8-9ed8-3c9513dba389" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Container ACL</link> to fetch all access policies associated with the container, modify the access policy that you wish to change, and then call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the complete set of data to perform the update.

trans-unit.source: Enabling Anonymous Public Access on Container Data
trans-unit.target: Enabling Anonymous Public Access on Container Data

trans-unit.source: To enable anonymous public read access on container data, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header set to <parameterReference>container</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>blob</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: To enable anonymous public read access on container data, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header set to <parameterReference>container</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>blob</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: To disable anonymous access, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> without specifying the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header.
trans-unit.target: To disable anonymous access, call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Set Container ACL</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> without specifying the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header.

trans-unit.source: If you set <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> to <parameterReference>blob</parameterReference>, clients can call the following operations anonymously:
trans-unit.target: If you set <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> to <parameterReference>blob</parameterReference>, clients can call the following operations anonymously:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="608f2eb2-c3b6-4c23-98d2-64c99f5a3c98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Block List</link> (for the committed block list only)
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="608f2eb2-c3b6-4c23-98d2-64c99f5a3c98" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Block List</link> (for the committed block list only)

trans-unit.source: If you set <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> to <parameterReference>container</parameterReference>, clients can call the following operations anonymously:
trans-unit.target: If you set <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> to <parameterReference>container</parameterReference>, clients can call the following operations anonymously:

trans-unit.source: The blob access operations listed above.
trans-unit.target: The blob access operations listed above.

trans-unit.source: Establishing Container-Level Access Policies
trans-unit.target: Establishing Container-Level Access Policies

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy can specify the start time, expiry time, and permissions for the shared access signatures with which it's associated.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy can specify the start time, expiry time, and permissions for the shared access signatures with which it's associated.

trans-unit.source: Depending on how you want to control access to your container or blob resource, you can specify all of these parameters within the stored access policy, and omit them from the URL for the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: Depending on how you want to control access to your container or blob resource, you can specify all of these parameters within the stored access policy, and omit them from the URL for the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: Doing so permits you to modify the associated signature's behavior at any time, as well as to revoke it.
trans-unit.target: Doing so permits you to modify the associated signature's behavior at any time, as well as to revoke it.

trans-unit.source: Or you can specify one or more of the access policy parameters within the stored access policy, and the others on the URL.
trans-unit.target: Or you can specify one or more of the access policy parameters within the stored access policy, and the others on the URL.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can specify all of the parameters on the URL.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can specify all of the parameters on the URL.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you can use the stored access policy to revoke the signature, but not to modify its behavior.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you can use the stored access policy to revoke the signature, but not to modify its behavior.

trans-unit.source: See specifying a <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink> for more information about establishing access policies.
trans-unit.target: See specifying a <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink> for more information about establishing access policies.

trans-unit.source: Together the shared access signature and the stored access policy must include all fields required to authenticate the signature.
trans-unit.target: Together the shared access signature and the stored access policy must include all fields required to authenticate the signature.

trans-unit.source: If any required fields are missing, the request will fail.
trans-unit.target: If any required fields are missing, the request will fail.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, if a field is specified both in the shared access signature URL and in the stored access policy, the request will fail with status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: Likewise, if a field is specified both in the shared access signature URL and in the stored access policy, the request will fail with status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: At most five separate access policies can be set for a given container at any time.
trans-unit.target: At most five separate access policies can be set for a given container at any time.

trans-unit.source: If more than five access policies are passed in the request body, then the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If more than five access policies are passed in the request body, then the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature can be issued on a container or a blob regardless of whether container data is available for anonymous read access.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature can be issued on a container or a blob regardless of whether container data is available for anonymous read access.

trans-unit.source: A shared access signature provides a greater measure of control over how, when, and to whom a resource is made accessible.
trans-unit.target: A shared access signature provides a greater measure of control over how, when, and to whom a resource is made accessible.

trans-unit.source: When you establish a stored access policy on a container, it may take up to 30 seconds to take effect.
trans-unit.target: When you establish a stored access policy on a container, it may take up to 30 seconds to take effect.

trans-unit.source: During this interval, a shared access signature that is associated with the stored access policy will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden), until the access policy becomes active.
trans-unit.target: During this interval, a shared access signature that is associated with the stored access policy will fail with status code 403 (Forbidden), until the access policy becomes active.

trans-unit.source: Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs
trans-unit.target: Restrict Access to Containers and Blobs

trans-unit.source: Create and Use a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Create and Use a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: Use a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Use a Stored Access Policy
